title: Assistive Gardening Tools | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Searching for garden tools for someone with gardening accessibility issues
subtasks: Considering tools with arched handles for leverage
Looking for longer handles for wheelchair or standing use
Evaluating extendable handles for adjustable reach
Checking out hand tools for kneeling or sitting ground work
Finding watering tools for standing, sitting, or overhead plant watering
Shopping at garden centers for accessibility tools
Requesting assistance from garden center staff in finding tools
Ordering tools from online suppliers
Seeking information from University of Wyoming Extension resources
Acknowledging assistance from Donna Hoffman (The Ground Up)

tasks.task: However, if the answer is to focus on the tasks directly related to the transcript content, perhaps with more emphasis on the search steps. After considering all this, I'll go with the Final Answer I initially drafted, giving a broad MAINTASK with subtasks that map to the main points of the transcript, which is about selecting garden tools for accessibility. I think this gives a clear picture of the next steps someone would take.
** Searching for garden tools for someone with gardening accessibility issues
subtasks: ** Considering tools with arched handles for better leverage
** Looking for longer handles to accommodate wheelchair or standing use
** Evaluating extendable handles for flexibility in reach
** Checking out hand tools designed for ground work (kneeling or sitting)
** Finding watering tools suitable for standing, sitting, or overhead plant care
** Shopping at local garden centers to view and handle tools
** Requesting assistance from garden center staff
** Ordering tools from online suppliers
** Accessing resources from the University of Wyoming Extension for further information
